thread.title: Investors Pull Back From Junk Bonds
thread.title_full: Investors Pull Back From Junk Bonds - WSJ

author: Matt Wirz
title: Investors Pull Back From Junk Bonds
text:
Investors are pulling back from the junk-bond market, in a shift that threatens to slow the global mergers-and-acquisitions boom.
Tepid demand forced European cable company Altice NV and U.S. chemical producer Olin Corp. in recent days to reduce the size of bond sales and boost interest payments.
The concessions mark the first... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
